text: I think that from the very beginning
that the gri was conceived uh we all
hoped that at some point the information
that was developed would be integrated
into uh financial reporting and become
part of the way in which managers and
investors judge the creation of value
and direct the creation of value for uh
for society and I think that what I find
exciting about the integrated reporting
project is that we now seem to be on a
track where we are going to attempt
convergence now I say attempt because I
think there's so many
complications and difficulties that are
going to have to be addressed very
intelligently that it's not absolutely
certain that the attempt will succeed
and I think that we should follow a
couple of rules uh in making sure that
the attempt is given the best possible
shot one of those rules is that uh the
stakeholder groups and the groups that
have been working on sustainability
reporting need to feel that this is a
genuine partnership and that there is a
this is not a recognition relatively
late by traditional accounting that
sustainability reporting is important
and therefore it's going to be absorbed
into a traditional accounting model I
think that would be considered uh a lost
Opportunity by the people who are
approaching this from the sustainability
side if on the other hand there is a uh
which I right now I think we're seeing
signs of a genuine effort to rethink
both the question of financial reporting
the creation of value and sustainability
reporting and find a way forward that
really measures the long-term
consequences of investment and corporate
decisions I think that will be very
exciting one of the issues that I think
needs to be thoroughly discussed was
discussed earlier today at our sessions
uh is whether we are going to continue
to rely on a fairly simple model of
shareholder Primacy that is the entire
function of the firm can be defined as
maximizing wealth for shareholders and
that everything else is a means to that
end or whether we're going to have a
broader and more balanced view of the
role of the corporation as providing
many services to society with investors
obviously providing a key resource and
their capital and deserving a return for
that but also the way in which employees
invest their time and energy and
customers convey their loyalty and give
their dollars in the form of Revenue so
uh I personally favor the latter in a
sense more interdependent balanced even
ecological model where we understand the
role of the firm to be uh valuable uh
and yet need to be constrained in some
ways um and I think that that's going to
require some really some real rethinking
on the part of those who have assumed
that simply maximizing profitability or
shareholder value would automatically
lead to all those other
benefits human beings Thrive through a
combination of competition and
cooperation competition Spurs us to be
uh Innovative and to apply our best
efforts but we also need cooperation in
order to achieve larger results than any
one of us can uh do by ourselves I think
the corporation is an extraordinarily
creative tool which combines the force
of cooperation and competition to ex
just exceptional ends can produce uh
enormous changes enormous numbers of
products provide jobs uh transform the
physical environment and so forth so it
is a very very powerful tool the
question then becomes what is that tool
going to be used for and I think
everyone who's involved wants to believe
that the corporation will be used
ultimately for ends that serve human
needs and the needs of the planet we may
have disagreements about the best way to
get there but uh and some people feel
that selecting one system or another
system of measurement uh leads you
closer or further away to that goal but
my vision of the corporation is
something that takes into account its
full impact on society and allows it
tremendous benefits to flourish while
minimizing the damage that it sometimes
can cause
